callapi.description: Make a call to the nostack api. Takes care of auth for the user. You need to specify a file with the graphql query and another one with a json of the variables, if anyare used.

queryFile.name: queryFile
queryFile.description: graphql file containing a single query

createstack.description: Creates a new moderator and stack.  Also logs in the moderator locally.
examples: $ nostack createStack -u franky -s tempstack, -e franky@gmail.com -w franky12$

licenseId.name: licenseId
licenseId.description: license id for the organization of the user

makecode.description: generates a starter app from a json provided by NoStack

userClass.name: userClass
userClass.description: user class for which to generate an app

newapp.description: create an empty new no-stack app.  Effectively combines create-react-app with apollo stuff and the no stack package.

baseApp.name: baseApp
baseApp.description: directory of the base app to copy. If it does not exist, it is created.

quickstarter.description: Creates a new moderator and stack.  Also logs in the moderator locally.
examples: $ nostack quickstarter -u franky -s tempstack, -e franky@gmail.com -w franky12$

baseApp.name: baseApp
baseApp.description: directory of the base app to copy. If it does not exist, it is created.

template.name: template
template.description: template from which to spin up a stack

licenseId.name: licenseId
licenseId.description: license id for the organization of the user

userClass.name: userClass
userClass.description: userClass for which to generate an app

resetstack.description: Resets the stack, meaning that the moderator remains and the stack is completely empty.  Essentially returns the status to before 'spinstack'.  WARNING: this is not reversable and will remove EVERYTHING, including your users!!!!

spinstack.description: Spins up a fully functional backend from a provided template.  The same template can then be used to generate front end code using the command 'makeCode'.

template.name: template
template.description: template from which to spin up a stack

email.name: email
email.description: email to be used by sample users

addedSuffix.name: addedSuffix
addedSuffix.description: added suffix for sample instances generated
